body: I made an issue https://github.com/pkg/sftp/issues/158 to ask for some help with this.

I've been unable to replicate the speedup with FileZilla - was the tests you did with the same files from the same server in the same direction?

Were you uploading or downloading?

Same files, same server, with the test back to back.
I was downloading files for my testing. My upload isnt fast enough to test that direction.

I found a public sftp server to do another test on using this webpage
http://www.sftp.net/public-online-sftp-servers
demo.wftpserver.com:2222	demo-user/demo-user

There are some larger files under the upload directory to test.
Downloading only 1 100MB file i maxed my connection at 120mbps with filezilla. i pulled only about 15mpbs with rclone.

issue.title: SFTP only works with --transfers=1

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
rclone v1.36
> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
SMP Debian 3.16.39-1+deb8u2 (2017-03-07)
> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
SFTP
> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone copy XX_SFTP:/ GS_XX:XX --include=XX* -vv --size-only --transfers=2
> A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
2017/05/01 17:13:48 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.36" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "XX_SFTP:/ XX:XX" "GS_XX:XX" "--include=XX*" "-vv" "--size-only" "--transfers=2"]
2017/05/01 17:13:58 INFO  : Storage bucket XX path XX: Modify window is 1s
2017/05/01 17:13:58 DEBUG : YYFILE: Excluded from sync (and deletion)
2017/05/01 17:13:58 DEBUG : XXFILE: Sizes identical
2017/05/01 17:13:58 DEBUG : XXFILE: Unchanged skipping
2017/05/01 17:13:58 ERROR : XXFILE2: Failed to copy: failed to open source object: Open failed: sftp: "The requested operation cannot be performed because there is a file transfer in progress." (SSH_FX_PERMISSION_DENIED)

Only 1 transfer can be done successful. when "--transfers=1" everything works fine. I can transfer multiple files from/to that same SFTP using lftp. What is the logical difference here? rclone is not opening multiple connections? Maybe?

Thanks for all the help!

issue.title: SFTP and ability to open multiple SSH connections vs multi transfer with 1 SSH connection

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
People are seeing faster speeds with applications like filezilla. I believe the secret in the speed is multiple SSH connections. Per the request of @ncw opening this issue. 

Possible to close earlier issues? 
https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/1158

body: This might be fixed by #1561 when done

This implements connection pooling for multiple ssh connections
    
    A connection may be opened for each `--transfers` and `--checkers`
    now.  Connections are checked when putting them in the pool and
    getting them out the pool so it should recover from network errors
    much better.

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.37-076-g5b6585f5/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Please test and reopen the issue if you are still having a problem, or make a new issue with more info.

Thanks

issue.title: How to avoid upload speed degrading with latency?

repository.name: sftp
repository.description: SFTP support for the go.crypto/ssh package

issue.body:
We've been integrating sftp package into [rclone](https://github.com/ncw/rclone) and it is working very well - a very nicely designed package, thank you.

However a user has noticed a performance problem which I've confirmed - the more latency in the internet connection, the slower the transfers.

I've been using [netelem](https://wiki.linuxfoundation.org/networking/netem) to set delays on localhost and trying transfers to and from a local sftp server.

  * At 1ms delay I get 100 MB/s
  * At 10ms delay I get 73 MB/s
  * At 100ms delay I get 9 MB/s

rclone uses the `File.ReadFrom` method to upload data.

I tried increasing `MaxPacket` in the client using a delay of 100ms, but anything greater than the default 32k just seemed to make things slower.

Any ideas on how to speed things up much appreciated.

Cheers

Nick

FYI Here is how I tested with rclone to a local sftp server

```
$ sudo tc qdisc change dev lo root netem delay 1ms
$ rclone -v copy /home/files/ISOs/ubuntu-16.04.1-desktop-amd64.iso TestSftp:
2017/02/20 22:28:02 INFO  : 
Transferred:   1.409 GBytes (100.970 MBytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:       14.2s
$ rclone delete TestSftp:ubuntu-16.04.1-desktop-amd64.iso

$ sudo tc qdisc change dev lo root netem delay 10ms
$ rclone -v copy /home/files/ISOs/ubuntu-16.04.1-desktop-amd64.iso TestSftp:
2017/02/20 22:28:38 INFO  : 
Transferred:   1.409 GBytes (73.208 MBytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:       19.7s
$ rclone delete TestSftp:ubuntu-16.04.1-desktop-amd64.iso

$ sudo tc qdisc change dev lo root netem delay 100ms
$ rclone -v copy /home/files/ISOs/ubuntu-16.04.1-desktop-amd64.iso TestSftp:
2017/02/20 22:31:34 INFO  : 
Transferred:   1.409 GBytes (9.362 MBytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:     2m34.1s
$ rclone delete TestSftp:ubuntu-16.04.1-desktop-amd64.iso
```

body:
Hmm, it appears that connection pooling, while excellent in itself, doesn't solve the fundamental problem.

I set up a local sftp server and ran

    sudo tc qdisc add dev lo root netem delay 50ms

Check that ping localhost gives the expected delay

```
$ ping localhost
PING localhost (127.0.0.1) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from localhost (127.0.0.1): icmp_seq=1 ttl=64 time=100 ms
64 bytes from localhost (127.0.0.1): icmp_seq=2 ttl=64 time=101 ms
^C
```

(Use this to remove the delay)

    sudo tc qdisc del dev lo root netem

To make a 100ms roundtrip delay.

I can get about 18 MB/s with the sftp binary

    sftp sftptest@localhost:1GB

Whereas if I try this with rclone I get about 1.5 MB/s

    rclone --stats 1s -v copy TestSftp:1GB /tmp

If I try them both with no latency then they are very similar 105MB/s rclone vs 128 MB/s sftp.

I tried a comparison with netcat also.  So running a netcat server in one window

    netcat -k -l localhost 9999 </dev/zero

I measured the speed with netcat in another

    netcat localhost 9999 | pv >/dev/null

Which came about at about 25 MB/s.

Using a simple [go netcat replacement](https://play.golang.org/p/cVPXSu3m23M) I wrote I get a very similar 26 MB/s

    ~/Go/netcat localhost 9999 | pv >/dev/null

So it doesn't appear to be a problem with the go TCP stack.  I did try increasing SO_RCV_BUF with no improvments.

@ncw While i understand most of what your doing. The finer details get over my head. I am not sure if its any help or not but i played around with lftp which supports both Multiple connections and Chunking of a single file "--parallel=8" and "--use-pget-n=8".  The latter of the two only works for downloads. While i didn't do a ton of testing i was able to pull up to 35+MB/s. This is in line with what i could do with filezilla(Maxing my connection). Not sure if it would contain some clues.

@justusiv I've commented further on https://github.com/pkg/sftp/issues/158 - it now looks to me like a bug in that package.  I made an ssh transfer with go at full speed and a tcp transfer it is just the sftp transfers which are slow over a long latency link.

I've managed to fix this issue by using a different interface in the sftp package :-)

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.41-069-gd4213c0a/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Can you give it a test and see if you agree?

In my tests the above works at the same rate as the `sftp` binary.  This may still be slower than FileZilla but it was over 10 times faster on a 100mS ping roundtrip link.

@ncw maxed my connection at 45MB/s! Thank you so much!

*EDIT*
The previous comment was with 8 transfers.
With 1 transfer i am getting 12.5MB/s  Not sure if there is a reason at the cap seemingly right at 100Mbps. Either way this light years improvement and am so thankful for the work you guys do.
